messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] memories and conceptions
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/2/03 1:01:31 PM, ecsamhill@earthlink.net writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/2/03 1:01:31 PM, ecsamhill@... writes:

<< I say "it's not age, it's technology". 20 years ago you didn't have the
internet (and us!) to entertain you in your enforced idleness, so of
course you had to dabble in low tech amusement. <eg> >>

AHA!!!

Maybe that's why my husband complains that his sex life is down.
Maybe it's that, or maybe it's that he's 25 years OLDER than when I first
helped him create unreasonable expectations for the remainder of his days.

I quit using birth control pills so that I wouldn't have so much blood clot
potential in a toe-to-hip cast. But after a few months, I got a cast just up
to the knee. And suddenly other things became possible!

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] memories and conceptions
messages.msgSnippet: **I had Kirby because I broke my leg.  Indirectly, but definitely related. So this time when I broke my leg I got a couple of moments of razzing from people
messages.messageBody:
**I had Kirby because I broke my leg. Indirectly, but definitely related.
So this time when I broke my leg I got a couple of moments of razzing
from
people who have known me 20 years, about not getting pregnant again.**

I say "it's not age, it's technology". 20 years ago you didn't have the
internet (and us!) to entertain you in your enforced idleness, so of
course you had to dabble in low tech amusement. <eg>

I'm sure that's the reason! <g>

Betsy

messages.subject: memories and conceptions
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/2/03 11:51:54 AM, lucie.caunter@sympatico.ca writes:  I was born there!  But I never
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/2/03 11:51:54 AM, lucie.caunter@... writes:

<< We lived in Augusta, Georgia
from 90 to 93. >>

I was born there! But I never lived there.

<<We have found memory of the South, including our third
son (family humour). >>

I think I was a conceived-in-Texas baby, but I'm not sure. Maybe conceived
in Aiken, South Carolina.

Kirby was conceived on a water bed at a friend's house in Boulder, Colorado.
Marty and Holly were conceived at our house, in a bed Holly now has in her
room.

I had Kirby because I broke my leg. Indirectly, but definitely related.
So this time when I broke my leg I got a couple of moments of razzing from
people who have known me 20 years, about not getting pregnant again.

Sandra
